availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: David Terrill (Green County, Kentucky, farmer and physician.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmer and physician. Virginia native. Married to Lucy M. Terrill. Father of Jackson M. Terrill and Felix Terrill. Physician in Adair County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer and physician in Green County, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Adair County, District 2, p. 72B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 1, p. 693.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, Upper Brush Creek Precinct, p. 510A.
"Dr David Terrill (1818-1871)," Find A Grave, Memorial 81191689, accessed March 27, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/81191689.
